thread.title: Victoria Beckham fails to crack a smile at New York hotel
thread.title_full: Victoria Beckham fails to crack a smile at New York hotel | Daily Mail Online

author: Ciara Farmer For Mailonline
title: Victoria Beckham fails to crack a smile at New York hotel
text:
Victoria Beckham has stepped out in NYC once again in the midst of her husband David's email leak woes.
The former Spice Girl was seen cutting a downcast figure as she departed her hotel sporting a loose-fitting ensemble and failing to crack a smile on Tuesday.
Her trip to the Big Apple comes as the scandal surrounding her football ace spouse rumbles on amid the shocking exposure of various alleged leaked notes from his personal email accounts.
Out again: Victoria Beckham has stepped out in NYC once again in the midst of her husband David's email leak woes
Victoria arrived in New York on Saturday, as the shocking scandal erupted, when it was alleged David was the victim of £1million blackmail plot over hacked emails.
While the couple's camp have commented on the stories, the former Spice Girl has remained stoic during her various outings in NYC, where she is taking a working trip to focus on her fashion brand.
The star has been seen in bold colours since she touched down, yet Tuesday's outing saw her go for a basic ensemble, with the only bright addition being her staggering white heels and saddle bag.
Masking her slender figure, she wrapped up in a soft burgundy jumper with volumunious grey trousers which hung off her frame.
Not now... The former Spice Girl was seen cutting a downcast figure as she departed her hotel sporting a loose-fitting ensemble and failing to crack a smile on Tuesday
It goes on... Her trip to the Big Apple comes as the scandal surrounding her football ace spouse rumbles on amid the shocking exposure of various alleged leaked notes from his personal email accounts
Upgrade your accessories with a bag by Victoria Beckham £1195 Victoria Beckham half moon shoulder bag
Bag it at Net-a-Porter...
Buy now
It may only be the beginning of February but we're already looking forward to when spring arrives.
Not only will it mean warmer weather and blue skies (we hope) but it means we can rock a new wardrobe too. We'll be ditching our cosy knits and practical outerwear as soon as we get a chance.
And that goes for our accessories too. Say goodbye to boring black bags and hello to a world of new season brights and stand out shades. This saddle bag, as seen being held ever so stylishly by Victoria Beckham, is just the thing.
From her current collection we love its half moon shape, minimal gold fastening and of course that wonderful shade of white. So why not get ahead of the game and click (right) to buy it now at Net-a-Porter?
Or get the look with our edit of white shoulder bags below.

Low-key and lovely: While mum and dad have been flitting around the big cities, their eldest son Brooklyn, 17, took an edgy snap as he posed in front of street art while wearing mismatched trainers
Not for me? The scandal has shaped around David not receiving a knighthood
While she is famous for her steely pout, Victoria has naturally remained straight-faced and stony since the scandal has surfaced.
David made his first public appearance since the scandal on Monday, when he appeared in casual sports garb while heading out for a juice yet kept a low profile.
While mum and dad have been flitting around the big cities, their eldest son Brooklyn, 17, took an edgy snap posted to Instagram on Tuesday, as he posed in front of street art while wearing mismatched trainers.
Victoria's appearance comes days after she was being rushed through London's Heathrow airport on Saturday following reports that David was a victim of a £1million blackmail plot over hacked emails.
It comes as MPs hit out against a potential 'bend it for Beckham' rule for the rich and famous amid claims the former footballer was advised on how to fit the Knighthood criteria.
There's a hole in my sleeve... She used a hole in her sleeve to pierce her thumb through
Unique... The fashion trailblazer sported a tight thumb ring
Walking strong: The famed designer was on her way out as she got to work in the Big Apple
Hitting back: It comes as MPs hit out against a potential 'bend it for Beckham' rule for the rich and famous amid claims the former footballer was advised by Whitehall on how to fit the Knighthood criteria
The politicians said today that celebrities should be treated no differently to ordinary members of the public when it comes to taxes and the honours systems.
The comments come amid reports that Beckham was on the verge of becoming Sir David in 2014 until a last-minute 'red flag' intervention from HMRC due to his involvement in an alleged tax avoidance scheme.
Insiders confirmed there was effectively then horse-trading between a Whitehall committee and the superstar's advisers to 'sort out' the issues raised by HMRC.
Rosena Allin-Khan, Labour’s shadow culture minister, said it was 'incredibly wrong' while Lib Dem MP John Pugh, a member of the influential Public Accounts Committee, said the same rules should apply for everyone.
Wowzers trousers: Victoria kept her look muted and chic
Rushed on: Her appearance comes two days after she was being rushed through London's Heathrow airport on Saturday following reports that her husband David was a victim of a £1million blackmail plot over hacked emails
Beckham and his PR machine have been left reeling after Friday's release of 18.6million emails and documents hacked by the Football Leaks website from the servers of Doyen Global, the firm run by the ex-footballer's PR chief Simon Oliveira.
According to the revelations, the Honours Committee had already agreed that Beckham's nomination – almost certainly proposed by his PR advisers – was well 'merited' before a routine check of his tax affairs.
The leaked emails also include a number of bombshells and series of sweary-rants and may even have been used as part of a £1million blackmail plot.
Straight faced: Victoria looked downcast and serious
Serious stuff: The comments come amid reports that Beckham was on the verge of becoming Sir David in 2014 until a last-minute 'red flag' intervention from HMRC due to his involvement in an alleged tax avoidance scheme
In one message the ex-England captain allegedly claims singer Katherine Jenkins, 36, got an OBE for ‘singing at the rugby and going to see the troops plus taking coke. F
